lom:description.lom:string:
Blogs on gender equity in engineering and science on the "Thus Spake Zuska" discussion site. She defines this category as dealing with gender equity in engineering and science education and in the workforce - issues of access, climate, and culture. This category also deals with feminist science theory and analyses being developed by those doing gender equity work in engineering & science. I discuss what might be missing from an adequate feminist theory of science and engineering, and what feminist insights might be missing from the "gender equity" analyses.
Zuska is the kick-ass alter-ego of Suzanne E Franks. When not dispensing Zuska's wisdom, Suzanne can often be found gardening, reading, or having one of her thrice-weekly migraines. She is Director of the Women in Engineering and Science Program ant Kansas State.

lom:title.lom:string: Engineering, Science, Gender Equity Discussions on Thus Spake Zuska
